ygData.subject: Re: More Charismat Carrilon data
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I just bought the song and have yet to try it out. I understand faction and all. I was wondering about npc s with no faction standing (say a bat, or a wasp
ygData.messageBody:
>From: David.Lynam@...
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] More Charismat Carrilon data
>Date: Wed, 2 Jun 1999 21:17:39 +0100
>
>From: David.Lynam@...
>
>no i mean they dont actually have a faction that they'd belong to...that
>would most certainly compliment the faction theory...
>
>Ka`Lend, 24th Wood Elven Bard on Rallos Zek
>

I just bought the song and have yet to try it out. I understand faction and
all. I was wondering about npc's with no faction standing (say a bat, or a
wasp for example - I would also think even Mistmoore Gargoyles fall under
this category), if you use the song on something that is "ready to attack",
does it make the creature "indifferent" or "apprehensive"?? Or does it only
work on npc's with faction ratings? It would be cool to be able to walk into
an evil city using this song, kinda like an evil enchanter could disguise
him/herself and walk into Freeport.

Sartori D'Elsiraad
Bard of Kelethin of the 15th Chorus
Veeshan
